column5: I havenâ€™t seen or met any dog that radiated any kind of intelligence, what I find scary is the â€The lights are on but the house is emptyâ€ look they have, not much makes me more uncomfortable than seeing these mindless creatures staring blanky at me while eating in hope of getting food, barking at nothing for hours or choking themselves against leads just to â€say hiâ€/attack me.

Dogs are pets in a sense that if you let them â€live freelyâ€ or whatever they will either end up dead, because they are domesticated/stupid and depenedant, or form packs, attack people, pollute the enviorment, kill wildlife and hump away til thereâ€™s hundreds of them.

They were bred to not show any signals before attacking because itâ€™d give them an advantage in dog fighting rings and they also have a lot of â€Gamenessâ€, a trait described as â€It gives the dog the ability to maintain the attack in baiting, despite ripped flesh, dehydration, exhaustion or broken bonesâ€ + they were bred with terriers to have a vicious bite so once they bite down they wonâ€™t let go. They defiently arenâ€™t safe to have around kids and I feel really bad for them since they canâ€™t have friends over because your husband is keeping dangerous dogs but its already pretty clear that keeping the dogs are one of his top priorities so I really donâ€™t think its weird that you are considering divorcing him.

I havenâ€™t used any but I think it partly depends on if the dog is actually intelligent enough to be able to connect that the sound starts when it barks = stop barking and the sound turns off but some dogs are just empty-headed barkmachines that wonâ€™t catch on no matter what. Also the noises those things make can sometimes be heard by infants, kids and teens so you might wanna try a simple dog whistle first.

Thats awful and I canâ€™t imagine what kind of people think that this is normal and that you should just get used to it because his behavior and mindset is absurd and if you look past the dog he is still

2. Gets mad and tries to control what you do with your free time

English isnâ€™t my first language and sometimes my mind blanks when it comes to how to phrase things correctly + I wrote that when I was deadass tired so yea its full of mistakes which is a little embaressing but its a bit too late to correct it  now

Iâ€™m really glad I could change your mind!! I wasnâ€™t aware that Pitbulls were so much more dangerous then other dogs either before I saw articles and personal stories here and started reading up on it cuz theyâ€™re advertised as misunderstood and thatâ€™s very easy to buy into when all the pits youâ€™ve met have been friendly and it gets difficult to imagine that they are a very dangerous breed due to the gameness and â€kill switchâ€ as well as how theyâ€™re built.

[Here](https://www.askadamskutner.com/dog-bites/bite-statistics-according-to-dog-breed/), [here](https://www.google.se/amp/s/www.forbes.com/sites/niallmccarthy/2018/09/13/americas-most-dangerous-dog-breeds-infographic/amp/), [here](http://bernews.com/2013/12/statistics-dog-attacks-interactions-by-breed/) and [here](https://www.charlesboyk-law.com/blog/injured-by-molosser-dog-bite/) are your statistics. Of course Pitbull type dogs can be sweet just as any dog (even chihuahuas...) can be considered sweet and be admired by people but you canâ€™t deny that pits are unsuitable as pets, especially as family pets, and people who insist that they are the exception when it comes to breed traits are, at best, just ignorant/not very educated. The â€Its the owner not the breedâ€ is repeated like its a religious mantra but Border collies were specifically bred to herd animals, Retrievers fetch, Bloodhounds track scents and Pitbulls were bred for bloodsport and fighting and, as you can tell by the statistics, it shows.

One of the reasons pitbull type dogs are especially dangerous is because they were bred for â€œGamenessâ€, wikipedia has a great description for it: â€In dog fighting breeds gameness is valued as it gives the dog the ability to maintain the attack in baiting, despite ripped flesh, dehydration, exhaustion or broken bones. "Game is the dog that won't quit fighting, the dog that'll die in the ring, the dog that'll fight with two broken legs." They were also bred to not display warning signals before attacking since that would give them an advantage in fights and thatâ€™s why they are frequently known to attack â€œwithout warning.â€.

I am not saying they are evil, its not their fault that they were bred to have these traits but they are an uneccesary risk to society since thereâ€™s hundreds of other breeds and I hope that you understand that no one is arguing with you for no reason.

â€Roxy is a beautiful pit mix that my next door neighbor bought early this year. They bought her as a pup at the same time that my neighborâ€™s had their first child, and as a professional dog trainer I always recommend introducing puppies to babies so they can grow up together and bond really strong.â€

Good invention however a huge chunk of the â€œpro trainersâ€ seem to have gone to some alternative dog fanatic school were actual medical professionals (yâ€™know those that actually have to try to fix the aftermath of dogs â€œbondingâ€ with babies) and the other portion of proâ€™s opinions are completely unheard of like I wish it was more common knowledge that dogs, much less pitbulls, shouldnâ€™t be left unsupervised with children but since â€œnanny dogsâ€ are a thing Iâ€™ve lost hope.

Also think its off putting that its all about the â€œpoor pittieâ€ when that poor child, + the neighboors, canâ€™t get any peace cuz Rosie decided to bark to the point of â€œalmost coughing herself to deathâ€ on a daily basis.

Oh god, I assume that people are joking about their pets being their babies but someone outright insisting its the same is nuts?? I seriously think a lot of owners have confused the â€A dog can memorize 200 words which is as much as an averege two year old canâ€ with â€My dog has human intelligenceâ€ (+ add the extra â€Mineâ€™s specialâ€) and then tries to proclaim themselves as a parent for what? The attention? I guess they need to feel important to be able to deal with having a creature thatâ€™s essentially as needy and dependant as a toddler for its entire life.

Oh god not only is the dog dumb as bricks but sheâ€™s putting people at risk since it canâ€™t even bother to move out of the way when thereâ€™s traffic so if she dosenâ€™t catch it someones might actually get traumatized running it over or there might even be a car accident if someone tries to avoid hitting it and crashes??

Dogs that are too braindead to realize its risky to stand in the middle of roads really piss me off and its nuts that sheâ€™s threatening you?!

Yep I feel the same way, I do understand that some people just need to vent about feeling shitty sometimes without them needing therapy but I have no respect for people that have a pattern of complaining about how bad their life is yet do nothing about it. I know the psychiatry is tough, I put myself in therapy when I was 13 and Iâ€™ve had shitty therapists and regular talk therapy doesnâ€™t do much for me but Iâ€™ve stuck with for 10 years and currently have 2 (soon 3) treatments that are really making a difference! 

I encourage people to consider it but thereâ€™s the issue that even if they would start going they would still have to invest in it instead of just clocking in on the meetings thinking itâ€™ll solve everything as well as finding a therapist that suits them (which is difficult if you donâ€™t know what you need/want) and have the energy to ask to see a new one or be referred to specific treatments which usually have long queâ€™s.

Big question is if youâ€™ll look back at this moment in 15 (or even 1) year and think â€Damn it was worth keeping that dog just so my kids wouldnâ€™t be devestated!â€, I get that itâ€™s hard being confronted by your kids feelings but as you said they donâ€™t even care about the dog. You can try to bring it up using a DBT communication technique called [Dear Man](https://www.therapistaid.com/therapy-worksheet/dbt-interpersonal-effectiveness-skills), the acronym stands for Describe, Express, Assert, Reinforce, Mindful and Negotiate and is meant to help with bringing up issues without making the other person get defensive. The link goes to TheraphistAid and you can download or preview a worksheet that explains all of it and maybe you can write down a draft about what you want to say before bringing it up. I really do sympathize and hope you can make your mom understand the effects it will have on you and that she really can wait with getting one until you leave.

I have written down my problems and looked for ways to cope but some just wonâ€™t go away no matter how hard I try because its a huge process and Iâ€™m in 2 (soon 3) theraphies to get better and the one Iâ€™m going to start is about being compassionate towards yourself and thatâ€™s very important if youâ€™re gonna try to improve because if you arenâ€™t kind to yourself you will push yourself too hard and perceived failures can make you spiral into self hate and thats what most of these posts seem to forget about. Reason 1: Genetics, a lot of people say â€œItâ€™s the owner not the breedâ€ like itâ€™s a biblical law. Border collies were specifically bred to herd animals, Retrievers fetch, Bloodhounds track scents and Pitbulls were bred for bloodsport and fighting.
